name: City of Charleston City Council
engagement_methods: Attend meetings; submit public comment or sign up to speak via Public Meeting Portal; submit FOIA requests
contact: City Clerk (meeting info) via Public Meeting Portal
notes: Meeting dates/time/location listed in 2026 schedule; agendas posted separately.
summary_text: Listed as a City of Charleston public board/commission/committee with publicly scheduled meetings.

name: City of Charleston Public Meeting Portal
engagement_methods: Submit written comments; sign up to speak for meetings if enabled by staff
notes: Portal allows public comment submission and speaker sign-up depending on meeting settings.
summary_text: Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more.

name: City of Charleston Planning Commission
engagement_methods: Attend meetings; speak in person (no sign-up required); submit written comments by noon the day before
contact: Planning Division (via portal or listed contact on page)
notes: Meets 3rd Wednesday monthly at 5:00 PM; public comments accepted in person or via portal.
summary_text: Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more.

name: City of Charleston FOIA Request Portal
engagement_methods: Submit FOIA requests for city records
notes: City provides online FOIA request submission.
summary_text: Listed as a City of Charleston public board/commission/committee with publicly scheduled meetings.

name: Charleston County Council
engagement_methods: Attend meetings; sign up for notifications; submit public comments by email
notes: Generally meets 2nd and 4th Tuesday; location listed on county council page.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: Charleston County Planning Commission
engagement_methods: Attend meetings; submit public comments on cases via Engage portal
notes: 2026 meeting dates, agenda packet, and comment instructions provided on Engage portal.
summary_text: We developed this site in an effort to provide more access and opportunity for the public to engage in cases that affect their communities.  Below you can provide your comments about cases that are currently under review by the Planning Commission.  You can also participate via text or email.   Let’s get started.

name: Charleston County FOIA Requests (OneRequest)
engagement_methods: Submit FOIA requests for county records
notes: County uses OneRequest portal for FOIA requests.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: Charleston County Boards and Commissions
engagement_methods: Apply for appointment (applications accepted quarterly)
notes: County advertises vacancies and accepts applications on a quarterly cycle.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: Charleston County School District Board of Trustees
engagement_methods: Attend board meetings; public comment sessions; observe Committee of the Whole meetings
notes: Public comment offered at Board meetings; Committee of the Whole meetings are public but no public comment.
summary_text: Board of Trustees The CCSD Board of Trustees typically meets on the second and fourth Mondays of each month.  Any exceptions to this meeting schedule will be posted publicly on the CCSD website.

name: City of Charleston Police Department - Office of Internal Affairs
engagement_methods: File complaint about officer conduct
notes: City provides complaint process through Internal Affairs.
summary_text: Listed as a City of Charleston public board/commission/committee with publicly scheduled meetings.

name: Charleston County Sheriff's Office - Office of Professional Standards
engagement_methods: File complaint about sheriff’s office personnel
notes: Sheriff’s office accepts citizen complaints.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: South Carolina Freedom of Information Act (SC FOIA)
engagement_methods: Request public records; rely on open meetings requirements
notes: Statewide law covering public records and meetings.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: South Carolina Judicial Department - Office of Disciplinary Counsel
engagement_methods: File complaint against a judge or lawyer
notes: Complaints must be written, signed, and mailed or delivered; email not accepted.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: South Carolina State Ethics Commission
engagement_methods: File ethics complaint (public officials/filers)
notes: Complaint form required; no electronic submissions per Commission guidance.
summary_text: Anyone who suspects that a violation of the Ethics Act has been committed by a public official, public member, or public employee may file a complaint with the State Ethics Commission.  Effective as of April 1, 2017 the SC State Ethics Commission has jurisdiction to accept complaints filed against members of the SC General Assembly and candidates for the House of Representatives and the SC Senate.  The State Ethics Commission is also authorized to file a complaint against any public official, public employee, or public member who is suspected of violating the Ethics Reform Act.   Electronic copies will not be accepted.

name: South Carolina Office of the Inspector General
engagement_methods: Submit complaint about improper governmental activity
notes: State IG accepts complaints about misuse of state resources or misconduct.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: South Carolina Department of Labor, Licensing and Regulation (LLR)
engagement_methods: File complaint against licensed professionals or businesses regulated by LLR boards
notes: LLR provides complaint forms and instructions by board.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: South Carolina Department of Consumer Affairs (SCDCA)
engagement_methods: File consumer complaint
notes: SCDCA handles consumer complaints and mediation.
summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: FOIA.gov (National FOIA Portal)

summary_text: Official websites use .gov A .gov website belongs to an official government organization in the United States.

summary_text: Public body with meetings/engagement listed at the provided URL; mission/purpose details require manual review.

name: City Council
engagement_methods: Attend meetings; submit comments or speaker sign-up via Public Meeting Portal when enabled; request records via FOIA
notes: Category listed in Agenda Center; agendas/minutes posted there.
summary_text: Local government is a generic term for the lowest tiers of governance or public administration within a particular sovereign state. A municipal council or local council is the legislative body of a municipality or local government area. Depending on the location and classification of the municipality it may be known as a city council, town council, town board, community council, borough council, rural council, village council, board of aldermen, or board of selectmen.
